questions.question: This cartoon was probably drawn during what time period?

choices.answer: Prior to the French Revoloution
After King Louis XVI's attempt to escape France
During the Reign of Terror
During Napoleon's Reign

questions.question: What was the cartoonist trying to say with this picture?

choices.answer: To persuade people to join the 1st and 2nd Estates
Persuade people to empathize with the 3rd Estate.
To understand the importance of a strong working class.
All of the above

questions.question: What is the cartoonist saying about the relationship among the three estates?

choices.answer: The 1st and 2nd Estates are above the 3rd Estate
The 1st and 2nd Estate can ruin the 3rd Estate
The Estate System in France in unequal
All of the above

questions.question: Which Estate paid the LEAST amount of taxes prior to the French Revolution?

choices.answer: Peasants
Bourgseoisie
Nobility
Workers

questions.question: What groups made up the 3 Estates in France?

choices.answer: Women, Men and Elite
Poor, Rich and the Middle
Clergy, Nobility and Poor/Everybody else
Knights, Slaves and Kings

questions.question: Which were the three main causes of the French Revolution?

choices.answer: Enlightenment spreading, failing economy and weak leadership
Slavery, immigration and ban on nobility
The war of 1812, Indian Removal Act and failing economy
Enlightenment, immigration and the War of 1812

questions.question: How did the Enlightenment ideas  effect the French Revolution?

choices.answer: The bourgeoisie believed the gov should protect rights
The nobility began to question the king and queen
Peasants stormed the Bastille and killed two guards
The Clergy forced the king to step down

questions.question: All of the following were economic causes of the French Revolution EXCEPT

choices.answer: The wasteful spending of the Monarchy
The large amount of money that was lent to the British army
The large amount of money that was lent to the Americans
The debt of the French government

questions.question: This radical group was known for their style of pants and their willingness to use violence

choices.answer: Emigres
Jacobins
San-Culottes
None of the above

questions.question: The bourgeoisie members of the 3rd Estate were unhappy with the Old Regime because

choices.answer: They did not like Marie Antoinette
They wanted to help the poor
The 1st and 2nd Estates had privileges that were denied them
They supported the American Revolution

questions.question: Which of the following was a major cause of the French Revolution?

choices.answer: Inequalities of the French Society (Estate System)
Assassination of Louis XVI
Lack of political influence by the Clergy
Disatrious war with Spain

questions.question: Which was a main reason that the 3rd Estate broke off to form the National Assembly  in 1789?

choices.answer: The 3rd Estate thought the 1st Estate would follow them
The 3rd Estate hoped to eliminate the Monarchy
The King refused to accept the 3rd Estate's DORM.
The voting system meant that the 3rd Estate always lost 2-1

questions.question: What did the 3rd Estate promise during the Tennis Court Oath?

choices.answer: To storm the Bastille and burn it down
To write a new constitution
To guillotine the King
To nominate Napoleon as King of France

questions.question: Which statement is best supported by the information found in this chart?

choices.answer: The Clergy were spared from the Reign of Terror.
The Reign of Terror affected all classed equally.
The Reign of Terror crossed social and economic boundaries
Peasants were the most frequent victim of the Terror

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the Reign of Terror during the French Revolution

choices.answer: An effort by the clergy and nobles to overthrow Robespierre
The strategic plan to invade and defeat Austria
The use of violence to kill enemies of the Revolution.
King Louis XVI's reaction to the National Assembly

questions.question: During the Reign of Terror, why did France go to war with Austria?

choices.answer: Marie Antoinette family was Austrian
Austria proposed that France put Louis back on the throne
Austria wanted to make their king Emperor of France
France wanted to gain control of Austria's natural resources

questions.question: The chaos which characterized the Reign of Terror led to the rise of which man?

choices.answer: Rousseau
Louis XVI
Napoleon Bonaparte
Montesquieu

questions.question: Napoleon seized power in France in 1799 through a violent, forceful takeover of the government.

choices.answer: Plebiscite
Concordant
Penisular
Coup d'etat

questions.question: One reason Napoleon was able to gain control of the French Government was that he

choices.answer: Was a strong supporter of individual rights
Was able to restore order in France
Had the support of the Catholic Church
Was a hero for his role in ending the Monarchy

questions.question: All of the following were major mistakes during Napoleon's reign EXCEPT

choices.answer: The invasion of Russia
The Peninsular War against Spain
The Continental System (Blockade)
He caused religious conflict

questions.question: Napoleon Bonaparte introduced a comprehensive system of laws called the

choices.answer: French Bill of Rights
Napoleonic Code
Declaration of the Rights of Man
French Constitution

questions.question: From 1807-1812, Napoleon Bonaparte

choices.answer: Controlled nearly all of Europe
Controlled all of Northern Africa
Waged battles throughout the world
Claimed a superior navy to Britians

questions.question: What was one of the main goals of the Congress of Vienna

choices.answer: Integrate enlightenment ideas into a Monarchy
Create constitutional republics throughout Europe
Restore the old order to a time before the French Revolution
Ensure Klemons von Metternich didn't become another Napoleon

questions.question: What was one of the main goals of the Congress of Vienna

choices.answer: To establish a new balance of power among European nations
To encourage the overthrow of the remaining monarchies
To divide the German Federation into independent states
To sign a peace treaty with Napoleon

questions.question: What happened at the Congress of Vienna that reversed much of what Napoleon had done in Europe?

choices.answer: It was forbidden to print the name Napoleon
Napoleon was banished to Elba Island
Every copy of the Napoleonic Code was destroyed
Many countries again became monarchies with Kings/Dukes
